alert.note: Alert for Potomac, Seeley Lake Region (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Missoula (Western Montana and Central Idaho)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 27 at 1:50PM MDT by NWS Missoula
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Missoula County through 215 PM MDT... At 148 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles west of Seeley Lake, or 26 miles northeast of Missoula. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Torrential rainfall and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm is impacting Jocko Canyon Road in rural areas of east central Missoula County. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
